title: Ineza Logo
content:
Hello all,   
   
Any thought's on this? These are unfortunately all the letters I have. I had to blow it up a bit. Thanks a lot.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524125828im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/29134.gif)
author: James Gareth

comments.content:
Prima Sans Bold? Stretched a little maybe.   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/prima-sans/bold/testdrive.html?s=ineza&p=72](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524125828/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/prima-sans/bold/testdrive.html?s=ineza&p=72)   
Enlarging the image didn't really help. If you   
squint at the original, then squint at the sample   
in the link I posted, there are some similarities.

I guess it could be any number of humanist-ish faces.   
Like [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/free-set/pt-free-set-demi-bold/testdrive.html?s=ineza&p=72](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524125828/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/free-set/pt-free-set-demi-bold/testdrive.html?s=ineza&p=72) from Paratype. With all of the distortion,   
it will take an expert (Troubleman? Coles? Chesh?) to ID it properly.

Isaac, that helps a lot. I never thought of it as a distorted humanist face. That helps a lot. I think it may even be Fruitiger black or something. I just found out that the this snippet is actually from a logo--the cineza logo for Sony's line of home projectors. They could have simply modified the z (pointy tips) and distorted Fruitiger or some other humanist face. Thanks isaac.
